messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling toilet-learning
messages.msgSnippet: Hooray for you and your little one! That is an acomplishment. Amy ... From: Pete Schult  To:  Sent:
messages.messageBody:
Hooray for you and your little one! That is an acomplishment.
Amy
----- Original Message -----
From: Pete Schult <schult@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 7:26 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling toilet-learning


> About 6 months ago I posted a question on the list about other
> parents' success in their kids learning how to use the toilet without
> coersion. I'm happy to say that our now 3yr9mo old has started to use
> the toilet on her own! We did break down and follow the advice of one
> site on toilet learning and offerred a jellybean for actually using
> the toilet, but we seem to have gotten the timing of the reward right
> because she started actually to urinate in the toilet shortly after
> the reward was offerred. She's still working on using the toilet for
> her BMs, but progress is being made!
>
> --Pete
> --
> --
> Pete Schult Stay at home Dad

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling toilet-learning
messages.msgSnippet: Pete- That s great news about your daughter s success with toilet learning. We re not even close to that point yet with our daughter, but I know that you re
messages.messageBody:
Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling toilet-learning Pete-
   That's great news about your daughter's success with toilet learning. We're not even close to that point yet with our daughter, but I know that you're doing it the right way. When they're ready, they'll do it, and if we push them before they're ready we'll have so much more to deal with than just changing diapers for a little while longer.

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated." - The Indigo Girls

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling toilet-learning
messages.msgSnippet: About 6 months ago I posted a question on the list about other parents success in their kids learning how to use the toilet without coersion. I m happy to say
messages.messageBody:
About 6 months ago I posted a question on the list about other
parents' success in their kids learning how to use the toilet without
coersion. I'm happy to say that our now 3yr9mo old has started to use
the toilet on her own! We did break down and follow the advice of one
site on toilet learning and offerred a jellybean for actually using
the toilet, but we seem to have gotten the timing of the reward right
because she started actually to urinate in the toilet shortly after
the reward was offerred. She's still working on using the toilet for
her BMs, but progress is being made!

--Pete
--
--
Pete Schult Stay at home Dad
http://people2.clarityconnect.com/webpages4/schult/default.html
mailto:schult@...
